intro: Matelea umbellata, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other plants with milky sap. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or limestone habitats. Matelea umbellata is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological importance as a nectar source for pollinators.
